<@UBS7QANF3> historic downloads working now. I am pretty sure betfair blocks too many concurrent requests (which I made and downloaded 10K+ files before betfair blocked). did not touch anything related to request parameters. anyways, few hours later and ran request script again. the download works and I have backed off number of concurrent file transfers.

text: <@U01DJ4DBF9R> has joined the channel

Hey guys, hopefully I can ask this here: what type of response latency can be expected for placing orders? In my case I see it in the couple hundred ms range. This is most likely a betfair thing as others have mentioned a similar response time in the betfair forums, but I couldn’t find any real info as to why that is.

elements.text: Hey guys, hopefully I can ask this here: what type of response latency can be expected for placing orders? In my case I see it in the couple hundred ms range. This is most likely a betfair thing as others have mentioned a similar response time in the betfair forums, but I couldn’t find any real info as to why that is.

text: Pre-event?

elements.text: Pre-event?

text: Yep

elements.text: Yep

text: i.e. with no bet delay?

elements.text: i.e. with no bet delay?

text: Then it's largely the time until the next matching cycle

elements.text: Then it's largely the time until the next matching cycle

text: Right, so that kind of latency is to be expected?

elements.text: Right, so that kind of latency is to be expected?

text: 160ms for me today on place

elements.text: 160ms for me today on place

text: I think it's cleaner to consider ping times or listMarketBook responses (or some other API call that doesn't involve the matcher) but from what you've said it doesn't sound out of line

text: <@U01D36QEBSB> has joined the channel
Difference between the publish time on a market book via steaming api for me and me receiving it is about 20ms, so then it’s around 200 - 40 = 160 for bf to process the place order request
